findings.title: Weak random number generator
findings.description: The current random number generator function used for genGene and genBattle functions is weak because it only depends on msg.sender, block.timestamp, and block.difficulty, which are predictable.

findings.title: Missing non-contract call checking
findings.description: In BlockchainMonster contract, the catchMonster and battleMonster functions are missing non-contract call checking. This allows an attacker to create a contract that makes a call to the BlockchainMonster contract and easily guess the result of the _random function in the BCMSettings.

findings.title: Unnecessary checks
findings.description: There are unnecessary checks in the portMonsterToken and catchMonsterByBCMC functions.

findings.title: Unnecessary check in the executeTrade function
findings.description: The totalFee is calculated from the price, but the price is checked with msg.sender already. So, the check require(totalFee < msg.value, "invalid_fee") here is unnecessary.

findings.title: Revert transaction if losing the battle
findings.description: The battle logic is quite complex to be handled on-chain and users need to battle to gain more exps.

findings.title: User can skip generating the battle if the kill rate > 0
findings.description: Users can manipulate the outcome of battles by skipping transactions based on the kill rate value, allowing them to always win.

findings.title: Unsafe type Inference
findings.description: The audit report highlights an issue with unsafe type inference.

findings.title: Explicit visibility of functions state variables (external, internal, private and public)
findings.description: Functions or state variables have explicit visibility set to external, internal, private, or public which can lead to security vulnerabilities.
